alert.note: Alert for Grant (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 12:13PM MDT until August 21 at 10:03PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Gila River Above Redrock affecting Grant County. For the Gila River...including Gila, Virden, Redrock...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Gila River Above Redrock. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 20.7 feet this afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM MDT.
